title: Manchester United want Marcelo Brozovic for £43million after being rebuffed in bid for Inter Milan and Croatia team-mate Ivan Perisic
text:
EFL Making his marc Manchester United want Marcelo Brozovic for £43million after being rebuffed in bid for Inter Milan and Croatia team-mate Ivan Perisic 
Inter Milan are set to allow Marcelo Brozovic to leave as soon as his £43m release clause is met Gossip 26th March 2017, 5:24 pm Updated: 26th March 2017, 8:00 pm Comments Manchester United are set to trigger Croatia midfielder Marcelo Brozovic’s £43million Inter Milan release clause. 
Jose Mourinho was in Zagreb earlier this week meeting transfer mastermind Predrag Mijatovic, reportedly in order to secure the summer signing of Brozovic’s club and international team-mate Ivan Perisic. Getty Images 4 Man United are set to activate Marcelo Brozovic’s £43m Inter release clause 
According to CalcioMercato , Perisic will cost well over £50m and Inter are preparing a new, big money contract offer to keep him at the San Siro. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But Mourinho also enquired about Brozovic while he was in Croatia, who the Nerrazurri are not believed to be as determined to keep hold of. 
If the box-to-box midfielder’s release clause is met, the Italian giants are willing to let him go in order to meet Uefa Financial Fair Play targets. Jose Mourinho denied that he was in the Balkan country to secure any transfer deals, and claimed his visit was for pleasure , rather than work. PA:Press Association United have been linked with fellow Croatian Ivan Perisic, but Inter are set to complicate matters by offering him a new contract Getty Images Inter are believed to be more willing to allow Brozovic to leave in order to meet Financial Fair Play targets PA:Press Association 4 Jose Mourinho has denied he was scouting either player in Zagreb, claiming he was just meeting friends 
The Special One added that the main reasons he was in Croatia were to enjoy the sun and meet friends, and Real Madrid legends, Mijatovic and Davor Suker. 
He told HNTV: “I have no hidden cause, I just came to enjoy my free days and visit some friends like Predrag Mijatovic and Davor Suker. Armed hooligan attacks referee during football match in Croatia 
“I know everyone believes I came to watch some players, but in football today you don’t have to travel around in order to see some players, I know all of them well. 
"I came as a person that wants to relax and enjoy the nice weather, unlike the rainy weather in Manchester..."
